freelancersPage.introTitle: Invoicing software designed for Spanish freelancers
introParagraph: If you're a freelancer, you know that invoicing takes more time than it should. Between Excel, outdated templates, doubts about Verifactu, and coordination with your gestoría, each invoice can take 10-15 minutes that you should invest in your business.

Invoo was born to solve exactly this. Invoicing software that understands Spanish reality: automatic AEAT compliance, direct integration with your gestoría, and an interface so simple you'll create invoices from your mobile while having coffee.
These are the reasons why freelancers like you are leaving Excel and choosing Invoo:
freelancersPage.faqTitle: Freelancers' frequent questions about Verifactu and Invoo

q1.question: What is Verifactu and why does it affect me as a freelancer?
q1.answer: Verifactu (RD 1007/2023) is the new mandatory electronic invoicing system for freelancers and SMEs in Spain. From July 2026, all freelancers must use approved software that generates invoices with QR code and sends information to AEAT in real-time. Invoo is 100% Verifactu compliant.

q2.question: Can I use Invoo from my mobile?
q2.answer: Yes. Invoo's web interface is mobile-optimized. Create invoices, log expenses with receipt photos, and check income from any device. No native app needed, works from any browser.

q3.question: How do I share invoices with my gestoría?
q3.answer: Your gestoría gets free access to a dashboard where they see all your invoices and expenses in real-time. You don't need to send PDFs by email or chase documents. Invite your gestoría once, and from then on everything syncs automatically.

q4.question: How long does it take to create my first invoice?
q4.answer: Less than 2 minutes including initial registration. Once your tax profile and first client are configured, subsequent invoices take 30 seconds.

q5.question: Does Invoo calculate VAT and withholdings automatically?
q5.answer: Yes. According to your tax regime (general, equivalence surcharge, IRPF), Invoo automatically applies VAT (21%, 10%, 4%) and withholdings (15% or 7% IRPF depending on cases). No manual calculations, no errors.

pymesPage.introTitle: Collaborative invoicing designed for small teams
introParagraph: Managing invoicing in a small business with 2-4 people is chaos without the right tools. Invoices created by different team members, lack of visibility about who invoiced what, and your accountant chasing documents scattered across emails.

Invoo centralizes all your team's invoicing in a single platform. Each member creates invoices with their user account, everyone sees the status in real-time, and your accountant accesses everything from their dashboard without asking.
These are the advantages that small business teams are discovering with Invoo:
pymesPage.faqTitle: Frequently asked questions from small businesses about team invoicing

q1.question: How many users can my small business account have?
q1.answer: The small business plan includes up to 4 users with full access. Each team member has their own login and can create invoices, record expenses, and view reports. Perfect for small teams where multiple people manage invoicing.

q2.question: Can I see who created each invoice in my team?
q2.answer: Yes. Each invoice shows who created it and when. This is fundamental for teams: you know who invoiced each service, you can audit internally, and your accountant has complete traceability of who issued which document.

q3.question: How does accountant access work with multiple users?
q3.answer: Your accountant sees all invoices and expenses from all users in your small business in a single dashboard. They don't need multiple logins or coordinate with each person. Everything centralized, real-time, no chasing emails.

q4.question: Can I limit what each user on my team can do?
q4.answer: Currently all users have full access (create invoices, view reports, export data). In future versions we'll add custom roles (e.g. "view only" vs "create and edit").

q5.question: Does Invoo comply with Verifactu for all team invoices?
q5.answer: Yes. Regardless of who creates the invoice in your team, Invoo automatically generates the Verifactu QR code, numbers consecutively, and submits to AEAT. 100% compliance without manual configuration per user.

hero.title: Frequently Asked Questions
hero.description: Find answers to the most common questions about Invoo, electronic invoicing and Verifactu

q1.question: Is Invoo VeriFactu compliant?
q1.answer: Yes. Invoo is built to meet the VeriFactu Regulation (RD 1007/2023). We generate the VeriFactu QR and manage the AEAT submission flow through our API provider. You can review statuses and export evidence for audits.

q2.question: When does VeriFactu become mandatory?
q2.answer: For software developers, from July 2025; for companies, from January 2026; and for the self-employed, from July 2026. Some details roll out in stages. We'll notify you in-app when we switch to production AEAT endpoints. If you wait until the last minute (like 38-40% of the self-employed, per surveys), you might face rushed adaptation costs; consider testing Invoo now for a smooth transition.

q3.question: Does VeriFactu mean invoices are "approved" instantly by AEAT?
q3.answer: No. Your invoice includes the QR and is submitted to AEAT, but acceptance depends on them. You can track the status and correct it if needed (e.g., rectifications).

q4.question: Do I need my own digital certificate?
q4.answer: Not to start. Our provider handles the secure exchange with AEAT; we manage technical payloads and return the QR and status. For enterprise customizations (like using your certificate), contact us later.

q5.question: Who is required to use VeriFactu?
q5.answer: Self-employed, SMEs, and companies billing under €6M annually, except for exemptions like REGE or large SII contributors. If you're a freelancer with few clients, choose simple software like Invoo; for gestorías with hundreds of clients, contact us for a better plan.

q6.question: What are the penalties for non-compliance with VeriFactu?
q6.answer: Up to €50,000 for not using approved software or tampering with records. Avoid it with Invoo, which ensures traceability. If preferring alternatives, check they're AEAT-certified, but Invoo integrates directly, reducing operational risks.

q7.question: Can I still use Excel or Word for invoicing?
q7.answer: No, VeriFactu requires approved software that sends data in real-time to AEAT. Invoo replaces that with a dead-simple interface; as an option, migrate Excel data via CSV, but we recommend automating to save billable time.

q1.question: Who is Invoo for?
q1.answer: Freelancers (autónomos) in Spain and their gestorías. We optimize for Spain-specific compliance and workflows. We don't replace your gestor, but enhance it, improving retention by reducing coordination errors.

q2.question: What does Invoo include at launch?
q2.answer: Core invoicing with VeriFactu QR + AEAT submission, expense capture, quarterly pre-calcs (Modelos 130 y 303), gestoría access, and CSV exports. Advanced features like multi-currency roll out progressively. Test the free plan to validate; if needing scalability, upgrade to Pro.

q3.question: Is there a mobile app?
q3.answer: Desktop-first, but mobile web is fully usable for on-the-go receipt scanning. A native app may come if demanded; meanwhile, use the browser for operational simplicity.

q4.question: Does Invoo support recurring invoices?
q4.answer: Yes, automate monthly sends for fixed clients. Set variations for extras without complexity. This maximizes billable hours; alternate with manual reminders if preferring total control, but automation lowers errors.

q5.question: Is Invoo easy for non-tech-savvy users?
q5.answer: Absolutely, with a dead-simple interface and step-by-step guides. Create invoices in <30 seconds without manual calculations. If the learning curve concerns you, start with our free onboarding; or integrate with your gestoría to delegate.

q6.question: Does Invoo handle multi-currency and international VAT?
q6.answer: Yes, it supports automatic conversions and VAT handling for foreign clients. It reduces tax complexity; as an alternative, export to external tools, but native integration simplifies retention.

q1.question: How much does Invoo cost?
q1.answer: Freelancers: Free Starter and Pro at €9.90/month; Gestorías: Free dashboard and custom Enterprise. Annual plans are available with savings. See the Pricing page for current tiers.

q2.question: Can I cancel anytime? Do you offer refunds?
q2.answer: Yes, monthly cancels anytime; 30-day refund on annual upgrades.

q3.question: Is the gestoría plan really free?
q3.answer: Yes, access to client data, CSV exports, notifications, and summaries at no cost. Enterprise for custom integrations.

q1.question: Where is my data stored?
q1.answer: In EU-based infrastructure with GDPR-compliant processors. We minimize retention and offer exports on request.

q2.question: Who can see my invoices and expenses?
q2.answer: Only you and any gestoría you explicitly invite. We never sell data; revoke access anytime.

q3.question: Can I export my data?
q3.answer: Yes, CSV (and soon XML for compliance artifacts) on demand.

q1.question: What happens if AEAT is down?
q1.answer: We queue submissions and retry automatically; you'll see a pending status until resolved.

q2.question: When will Invoo be generally available?
q2.answer: We're preparing to launch with a small pilot, then expanding. We won't publish an exact date until ready. Join the waitlist for early access.

q3.question: How does VeriFactu affect my gestoría?
q3.answer: Gestorías must use it for their own invoicing and will benefit from dashboards like ours: real-time client visibility, zero manual entry.

object.title: Purpose of Contract and Service Description

contractObject.title: Purpose of Contract
contractObject.content: These Terms govern the conditions under which the User accesses and uses Invoo, as well as the rights and obligations of both parties. The contract comprises the use of invoicing and management software, the generation and recording of digital invoices, the submission of Invoicing Records to the Tax Administration through external tax connectivity providers, access to the panel for gestorías, and other complementary functionalities offered on the Platform. Access or use of the Service implies full acceptance of this document.

serviceDescription.title: Service Description
serviceDescription.content:
Invoo is a digital platform aimed at professionals and businesses that allows issuing and managing electronic invoices, generating PDF versions, numbering them correctly, and incorporating the official QR code when the User operates under Verifactu. It also transforms each invoice into an Invoicing Record in accordance with Royal Decree 1007/2023, including the metadata, chaining, and hashes required by regulations.

The Service also enables automatic submission of these records to the Tax Administration through an external tax connectivity provider (currently Verifacti (Bilbabit, S.L.)) acting as a technical intermediary. Transmission may occur in real-time or within the timeframes permitted by regulations, and the Administration may accept or reject the submitted records, something entirely beyond Invoo's control.

Additionally, the Platform allows managing clients, products, and services, storing data and automating recurring information. It offers an expense recording system through uploading and classifying receipts or invoices, as well as exporting such data for gestorías. It also generates preliminary tax calculations such as estimates for models 130 or 303, although these calculations are merely indicative and do not constitute tax advice or a filed declaration. Finally, the User can share information with their gestoría through a secure link that allows consulting invoices, expenses, and the status of Invoicing Records.

serviceNature.title: Nature of the Service
serviceNature.content: Invoo is software provided under a SaaS model accessible entirely online without the need for local installation. It does not act as a gestoría, tax advisor, or representative of the User before the AEAT. The Service does not replace the review or analysis by the User or their advisor, nor does it guarantee by itself full compliance with all applicable tax obligations.

noAdvice.title: No Provision of Tax, Legal, or Accounting Advice
noAdvice.content: The User acknowledges that Invoo does not provide tax, legal, or accounting advice. Automatic functionalities, including tax model estimates, are merely informative in nature. The User's tax configuration (tax rates, headings, regimes, exemptions, or deductions) depends exclusively on the User themselves, who is also solely responsible for reviewing, validating, and filing their taxes, directly or through their gestoría.

serviceEvolution.title: Service Evolution

The User must maintain adequate copies of their tax documentation and, when acting through a gestoría, verify that it has the necessary information to carry out its work. technicalIntegration.title: Technical Integration with Verifacti
technicalIntegration.content:
Invoo integrates in its operation the API of Verifacti, owned by Bilbabit, S.L., in order to generate the official QR code, produce the Invoicing Record required by Spanish regulations, and submit it to the Tax Administration. This integration is carried out exclusively for technical purposes and does not establish any contractual relationship between the User and Verifacti. The provision of the Service is articulated at all times between the User and Invoo.

The generation of the Invoicing Record and its submission to the Administration necessarily depend on the infrastructure and availability of the API provider. Invoo does not control the internal operation of said provider and merely integrates it under the terms provided in its own license of use. Any action, update, or technical change that Verifacti implements may temporarily affect the behavior of the Service, without this implying breach by Invoo.

recordSubmission.title: Submission of Invoicing Records to AEAT or Other Administrations
recordSubmission.content:
When the User issues an invoice through Invoo, the Platform generates the necessary data to produce the Invoicing Record and automatically sends it to Verifacti, which is responsible for preparing the XML file required by regulations and submitting it to the competent Tax Administration. Acceptance, rejection, or return of the record depends exclusively on the Administration and the technical criteria applicable at any given time.

The obligation to review the status of records and confirm their proper submission corresponds solely to the User. Invoo will display the available information in each case, but cannot guarantee that the Administration will accept the generated Invoicing Records, or that regulatory or interpretive changes will not affect the process. In no case will the use of Invoo be considered automatic or complete compliance with the User's tax obligations.

The User is responsible for checking whether they are required to use Verifactu in accordance with the tax regulations applicable to them.

thirdPartyDependency.content:

The unavailability of any of them may temporarily prevent the generation or submission of records. Such incidents may be due to service outages, scheduled maintenance, network problems, regulatory updates, or technical errors external to Invoo.

In such situations, it will be up to the User to resend, repeat, or review pending information, as well as to adopt appropriate measures to comply with their tax obligations. dataQuality.content: The quality of the Invoicing Record depends entirely on the data that the User enters on the Platform. Invoo does not verify its accuracy or tax adequacy. The Administration may reject records containing material errors, inconsistencies, incomplete data, or any other defect attributable to the User. In such cases, the review and correction of information will correspond to the User themselves or the gestoría acting on their behalf.

regulatoryEvolution.title: Regulatory Evolution and Updates
regulatoryEvolution.content: The regulatory framework of the Verifactu system may evolve with technical modifications, new versions of regulations, or changes in validation requirements. However, the User acknowledges that such updates may require technical adjustments, temporary revisions, or provider changes, and that such processes do not constitute non-conformity of the Service.

preferences.content: They allow certain User configurations to be remembered, such as language or interface settings. Disabling them does not prevent the use of the Website, but may affect the experience.

analytics.content:

specificCookies.title: Specific cookies used
specificCookies.intro: The following describes the main cookies that may be installed during navigation:

technical.content:

analytics.content:

legalBasis.content:

internationalTransfers.content: In the case of cookies managed by third parties established outside the European Economic Area, the associated data transfers will be carried out in accordance with the guarantees provided for in articles 44 and following of the GDPR (such as standard contractual clauses).

retention.title: Data retention
retention.content: The retention time depends on the type of cookie. Session cookies are automatically deleted when the browser is closed. Persistent cookies remain on the device for a period that can range from several days to several months, depending on the provider's configuration.
